DbExpression Class

Definition

Represents the base type for all expressions.

In this Article

public abstract class DbExpression
Inheritance
System.Object
DbExpression

Inherited Members

GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

No content here will be updated; please do not add material here.

Properties

ExpressionKind

Gets the kind of the expression, which indicates the operation of this expression.

public System.Data.Common.CommandTrees.DbExpressionKind ExpressionKind { get; }
Value
DbExpressionKind

The kind of the expression, which indicates the operation of this expression.

ResultType

Gets the type metadata for the result type of the expression.

public System.Data.Metadata.Edm.TypeUsage ResultType { get; }
Value
TypeUsage

The type metadata for the result type of the expression.

Methods

Accept(DbExpressionVisitor)

Implements the visitor pattern for expressions that do not produce a result value.

public abstract void Accept (System.Data.Common.CommandTrees.DbExpressionVisitor visitor);
visitor
DbExpressionVisitor

An instance of DbExpressionVisitor.

Accept<TResultType>(DbExpressionVisitor<TResultType>)

Implements the visitor pattern for expressions that produce a result value of a specific type.

public abstract TResultType Accept<TResultType> (System.Data.Common.CommandTrees.DbExpressionVisitor<TResultType> visitor);
visitor
DbExpressionVisitor<TResultType>

An instance of DbExpressionVisitor.

Returns
TResultType

The type of the result produced by DbExpressionVisitor.

Determines whether the specified Object is equal to the current DbExpression instance.

public override bool Equals (object obj);
obj
System.Object

The object to compare to the current DbExpression.

Returns
Boolean

True if the specified Object is equal to the current DbExpression instance; otherwise, false.
